rules.text: Installations must be at individual households or small farms where baseline manure decays anaerobically without methane recovery.
Projects may mix small amounts of other agricultural wastes, but emission reductions may only reflect manure.
Aggregated emission reductions across all included systems must remain â‰¤60 kt CO2e per year.
Only the manure fraction that decays anaerobically in the baseline may be credited and must be established via a 90/10 survey.
Demonstrate additionality using TOOL21 or by showing no regulation requires household methane recovery.
Baseline methane emissions follow Equation (13) using animal populations, volatile solids, B0 and MCF values.
Project emissions must account for methane losses, fossil fuels and electricity use via TOOL14, TOOL03 and TOOL05.
Assess leakage from shifts in biomass fuels, manure use and transport via TOOL22 and SSC sampling standards.
Monitor all parameters in Table 6.1 and maintain documented O&M and rehabilitation services for every digester.
